title: UN finds that prospects for economic growth in 2020 hinge on reducing trade disputes and uncertainty
text:
Impacted by prolonged trade disputes, the global economy suffered its lowest growth in a decade, slipping to 2.3 per cent in 2019. The world, however, could see a slight uptick in economic activity in 2020 if risks are kept at bay, according to the United Nations World Economic Situation and Prospects (WESP) 2020, which was launched today. The Report states that growth of 2.5 per cent in 2020 is possible,… Read more on https://africa-newsroom.com/press/un-finds-that-prospects-for-economic-growth-in-2020-hinge-on-reducing-trade-disputes-and-uncertainty?lang=en
